Body: I am developing my IOT device which has a server component that needs to be accessed from the internet. Well, I would like my clients to access it without configuring their home routers with port forwarding. I am ready to buy AWS instance or any other suggested intermediate servers. Can anybody recommend how to do it? I see IP cameras implement a similar concept.
Do we have any other suggestions? I am working on a IP camera that needs video streaming to external network without configuring home routers.

You can use AWS EC2 instance and assign an elastic IP to it, so it can be accessed directly. You can find more information about EC2 instances [here](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/de_de/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/concepts.html) and about elastic IP [here](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/elastic-ip-addresses-eip.html).
There are some other ways as well but depends on your project
